HTMLElementDel.summary: The <del> HTML element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document. This can be used when rendering "track changes" or source code diff information, for example. The ins element can be used for the opposite purpose: to indicate text that has been added to the document.

remarks.para: This element is often (but need not be) rendered by applying a strike-through style to the text.

-ins element for insertions into a text
-s element for strikethrough separate from representing deletion of text
